example.eg: A warning sound beeps when you start to go backward.
example.egtrans: 倒车的时候，你会听到滴滴的警报声。

example.eg: Some people like to walk backward for exercise.
example.egtrans: 有的人喜欢反向走路，达到锻炼的目的。

example.eg: He strode on without even a backward glance.
example.egtrans: 他大步地走去，连头也不往后回一下。

example.eg: The school offered some extra help for the backward student.
example.egtrans: 学校为那些有学习障碍的学生提供额外的帮助。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 落后的, 有学习障碍的

example.eg: The people may seem a little backward but they're very friendly.
example.egtrans: 这些人可能看着有点反应迟钝，但是非常友好。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 迟钝的, 进步迟缓的

example.eg: Even though it's close to a metropolitan area, this region is still backward.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 落后的, 发展缓慢的

example.eg: She wasn't backward in sharing her opinions with us.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 勉强的，不情愿的, 犹豫的

example.eg: The racial tension problem in this city seems to be moving backwards.
example.egtrans: 该城市的种族冲突问题似乎每况愈下。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 倒退的, 每况愈下的

example.eg: This country seems to be going backward in its attitudes to human rights.
Drake thought he was making progress, but suddenly he felt he was moving backward.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 回到原状, 恢复之前的状态, 重蹈覆辙

example.eg: Take a backward step so you won't be so close to the edge!
He took a backward step when he had to quit his job.
Some people consider the government's proposal to be a backward-looking move.

dsense.name: backwards and forwards, backward and forward

example.eg: I've spent the whole day rushing backwards and forwards.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 来来回回, 反反复复

dsense.name: backwards and forwards, backward and forward

example.eg: Ed searched the records backwards and forwards.

dsense.name: bend over backward (US), bend over backwards (UK)

example.eg: The coach told the players that they would have to bend over backwards if they wanted to win the game.

dsense.name: bend over backward for [sb] (US),  bend over backwards for [sb] (UK)

example.eg: Nicole bent over backwards for her brother when he needed help.

dsense.name: bend over backward to do [sth] (US), bend over backwards to do [sth] (UK)

example.eg: Linda bent over backwards to please her boss.
